InjectorEmailConfiguration.DefaultEmailBodyText:
Dearest Neo,

Please fix your broken software. I thought this was supposed to make my life easier?

With Love,
A Pissed off Tech

OEAppPath: C:\Vehicle Software\Mitsubishi\Mitsubishi Motors Service Information Retrieval.website
C:\Vehicle Software\VW Audi\erWin Online  Volkswagen of America  erWin Online.website
C:\Vehicle Software\VW Audi\Offboard Diagnostic Information System.lnk

SettingsEntries.SettingDescription: Specifies if we should show the selection box popup for the FulcrumShim when it's loaded up by an application. This is set to false by default so we can make sure that devices aren't lost during this period where the selection box is open.
Sets the default FulcrumShim DLL Value to load when a new instance of the ShimDLL is booted up. This defaults to the Version 04.04 API for a CarDAQ-Plus 3 device.
Enables or disables automatic configuration of a connected CarDAQ-Plus 3 if one is present. By default, this is set to off. (Requires app restart to take effect)
Enables or disables the voltage monitoring routines for when a device is selected in this application. By default, this is turned off. (Requires application restart to take effect)
Enables or disables the Auto ID routines for when voltage is picked up by this application. This will NOT work if voltage monitoring is turned off. By default, this is turned off

This configures the size of the input pipe reading buffer in bytes. This value shouldn't really need to be changed unless we're working with a vehicle that has a TON of output data. The default value for this is 10240 bytes

This timeout value determines how long our pipe readers will wait before timing out on a connection attempt. This shouldn't need changing but in the event OE Applications are crashing when using the FulcrumShim, this value can be turned down to a lower value and may have helpful results. The default value is 10000ms

This timeout value determines how long our pipe readers will wait before timing out on a reading attempt. This shouldn't need changing but in the event OE Applications are crashing when using the FulcrumShim, this value can be turned down to a lower value and may have helpful results. The default value is 100ms

Toggles if we should enable the directory watchdog monitor for specified folders inside our JSON configuration file.  This monitor is used to find new files in specified folders and perform some routine with them. The most common action is automatic conversion from a PassThru log file to a .ptExp file or a .ptSim file.  Changing this setting requires a restart to take effect. To configure folders to monitor for this watchdog, use the JSON configuration file located in the FulcrumInjector's install location or by clicking the Advanced Settings button at the top of the window.

Sets the minimum amount of time required to wait between executions of a requested watchdog action. This is done to avoid running operations on files which already were processed in a previous action.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Open command values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Close command values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Connect command values. This regex contains a total of 6 groups!. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Disconnect command values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Read Messages command values. This also prints out the messages processed in this command. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Write Messages command values This also prints out the message objects that are sent in this command. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Start Message Filter command contents. This does NOT pull out contents for the message filter values themselves. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Stop Message Filter command contents. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru IO Control Commands.  This should define both the IOCTL Pulling methods ONLY for the main command line. The IOCTL Values are defined in the IOCTL Value Regex. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru command issue time values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern for pulling the values issues in hexadecimal format to our J2534 API. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru command result status code values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Open Device ID values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Connect channel Id command result values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Start Filter filter Id command result values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our PassThru Connect channel Id command result values. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out message hex data for sent or read message values from any kind of message based command. This includes filters, send, read, or periodic message commands. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our message contents sent during PTWrite Command. THIS REALLY SHOULD NOT BE TOUCHED! To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our message contents read during a PTRead Command. THIS REALLY SHOULD NOT BE TOUCHED!. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our message contents for each part of a message filter built during a PTStartMsgFilter command. THIS REALLY SHOULD NOT BE TOUCHED!. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

This regular expression is used to configure the pattern used to pull out values for our IOCTL Content Values. This will extract the names and values of each parameter set on an IOCTL command if any are given. THIS REALLY SHOULD NOT BE TOUCHED!. To define groups to pull values from include *GROUPS_(GroupNumber,GroupNumber)* where GroupNumber is a number of the group to use.

Configure this list of colors to include a set of desired syntax highlighting formats for the type of J2534 API call and time issued when a new command. Color 1 is the time, color 2 is the type definition, color 3 is the PT command name color. To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.

Configure this list of colors to include a set of desired syntax highlighting formats for the different types of parameters issued on a J2534 command. Color 1 is for digits, color 2 is for Hex values, color 3 is for string values, color for is for all other values. To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.

Configure this list of colors to include a set of desired syntax highlighting formats for any CAN data read from a PTReadMessages command into this application that gets displayed in a log file. Color 1 is the message index, color 2 is the time read, color 3 is the message protocol, color 4 is the message data size, color 5 is RX Flags, color 6 is RX Flag values, color 7 the message data. To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.

Configure this list of colors to include a set of desired syntax highlighting formats for any CAN data read from a PTReadMessages command into this application that gets displayed in a log file. Color 1 is the message index, color 2 is the time read, color 3 is the message protocol, color 4 is the message data size, color 5 is RX Flags, color 6 is RX Flag values, color 7 the message data. To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.

Configure this list of colors to include a set of desired syntax highlighting formats for any CAN data read from a PTReadMessages command into this application that gets displayed in a log file. Color 1 is the message index, color 2 is the time read, color 3 is the message protocol, color 4 is the message data size, color 5 is RX Flags, color 6 is RX Flag values, color 7 the message data. To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.
Enables or disables the use of regular expression filtering when filtering or searching debug log output. This is turned OffF by default
Sets if the debug log view pane should hide lines not matching filtering text or not. This is turned on by default.

Set this color entry to set the desired syntax highlighting format for the call stack of a log line.  To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.

Configure this list of colors to include a set of desired syntax highlighting formats for log level entered for a given debug line (Normally we have a total of 6 levels).  To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.

Set this color entry to store a color value for the names of loggers called on a formatted debug line.  To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.

Configure this list of colors to include a set of desired syntax highlighting formats for the time of a debug log entry.  To specify a background color, both the foreground and background in a pair of parentheses with the foreground color first.
